resources.string: Thanks for downloading this app! If you don\'t find many sensors, it\'s because you don\'t have them! ðŸ˜Ÿ
The update has just been downloaded !

Page dedicated to the informations regarding the software and hardware parts of the device in use.
Page dedicated to the informations regarding Wi-Fi and mobile connection of the device in use.
From Android 8 (Oreo), the operating system requests location access for connection informations.
From Android 6 (Marshmallow), the operating system no longer provides the ability to obtain the MAC address of the device. For this reason, the constant 02:00:00:00:00:00 results.
Page dedicated to the informations regarding the coordinates detected by the GPS signal of the device in use.
If you want to get the coordinates of your position, please activate the GPS.

Attention!\n\n If you find that the current capacity has an unlikely value or it\'s even 0, it is probably caused by the components chosen by the device manufacturer. This same reason applies to the battery total capacity.

If the difference ( %1$d ) between the percentage of battery charge shown and the actual percentage of battery charge is equal to or greater than 10, we recommend following the guide below regarding battery calibration.

1. Drain your smartphone battery until it turns itself off. Next, you need to turn the phone back on and, if it stays on, you have to wait for it to turn itself off again. Repeat the operation until the point that when you turn the smartphone back on, it turns off immediately. 

2. At this point put the device on charge (from off) and wait for the battery indicator to reach 100%. Then let the phone charge for another one/two hours and ignore any messages that appear on the screen. This is an IMPORTANT step but you don't have to overdo it: after the due time, unplug the phone from the charge or you could damage the battery. 

3. Now remove the battery from the smartphone for 10-15 minutes and then reinsert it. If your smartphone does not allow you to remove the battery, keep the device off for the same amount of time. 

4. Once the operation is complete, put the phone back in charge and wait 5 minutes, then turn on the smartphone, wait for the main Android screen to be usable and disconnect the charger. This way you should be able to calibrate the device battery. 

DISCLAIMER
Sensorify relieves itself of any responsibility due to possible damage to the battery. Guide offered by Salvatore Aranzulla's computer science site Aranzulla.it.

What is it ?

 An ambient light sensor is a photodetector that is used to sense the amount of ambient light present, and appropriately dim the device's screen to match it. This avoids having the screen be too bright when the user's pupils are adapted for vision in a dark room, or too dim when the device is used outdoors in the daytime. Dimming the screen on a mobile device also prolongs the lifetime of the battery.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org

What is it ?

 A barometer is a scientific instrument that is used to measure air pressure in a certain environment. Pressure tendency can forecast short term changes in the weather. Many measurements of air pressure are used within surface weather analysis to help find surface troughs, pressure systems and frontal boundaries.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org

What is it ?

 A gyroscope is a device used for measuring or maintaining orientation and angular velocity. It is a spinning wheel or disc in which the axis of rotation (spin axis) is free to assume any orientation by itself. When rotating, the orientation of this axis is unaffected by tilting or rotation of the mounting, according to the conservation of angular momentum.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org

What is it ?

 The rotation-vector sensor the orientation of the device with respect to Earth's coordinate system as a unit quaternion. Specifically, the rotation vector represents the orientation of the device as a combination of an angle and an axis, in which the device has rotated through an angle Î¸ around an axis (x, y, z). The elements of the rotation vector are unitless.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org

What is it ?

 A magnetometer is a device that measures magnetism - the direction, strength, or relative change of a magnetic field at a particular location. A compass is one such device that measures the direction of an ambient magnetic field, in this case, the Earth's magnetic field.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org

What is it ?

 A proximity sensor is a sensor able to detect the presence of nearby objects without any physical contact. A proximity sensor often emits an electromagnetic field or a beam of electromagnetic radiation (infrared, for instance), and looks for changes in the field or return signal. The object being sensed is often referred to as the proximity sensor's target. Different proximity sensor targets demand different sensors. Proximity sensors can have a high reliability and long functional life because of the absence of mechanical parts and lack of physical contact between the sensor and the sensed object.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org

What is it ?

 A compass is an instrument used for navigation and orientation that shows direction relative to the geographic cardinal directions. Usually, a diagram called a compass rose shows the directions north, south, east, and west on the compass face as abbreviated initials. Compasses often display markings for angles in degrees in addition to (or sometimes instead of) the rose. North corresponds to 0Â°, and the angles increase clockwise, so east is 90Â° degrees, south is 180Â°, and west is 270Â°.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org
It looks like you took your finger off the camera. Place your finger correctly and try again.

What is it ?

 A photoplethysmogram (PPG) is an optically obtained plethysmogram that can be used to detect blood volume changes in the microvascular bed of tissue. A PPG is often obtained by using a pulse oximeter which illuminates the skin and measures changes in light absorption. To measure the heart rate, therefore, we will simulate a PPG using the camera and the flash.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org

What is it ?

 A pedometer is a device that counts each step a person takes by detecting the motion of the person's hands or hips. Because the distance of each person's step varies, an informal calibration, performed by the user, is required if presentation of the distance covered in a unit of length (such as in kilometers or miles) is desired, though there are now pedometers that use electronics and software to automatically determine how a person's step varies.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org
Hold your phone vertically for better response. Play this audio 4â€“5 times for a better result !
Use this audio to clean the device speakers from dirt or liquid infiltration, like water.

What is it ?

 The sound level meter is a sound pressure level meter, that is the amplitude of the pressure wave, or sound wave. Unlike what one might think, the sound level meter shows negative values for that acoustic pressure that the human ear is unable to hear. The positive values, therefore, demonstrate the acoustic pressure audible to man.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org

What is it ?

 An accelerometer is a measuring instrument capable of detecting and/or measuring acceleration, by calculating the detected force with respect to the mass of the object (force per unit of mass). An accelerometer at rest on the surface of the Earth will measure an acceleration due to Earth's gravity, straight upwards (by definition) of g â‰ˆ 9.81 m/sÂ².

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org

What is it ?

 The linear acceleration is a vector quantity representing the variation of speed in the unit of time. In differential terms, it is equal to the derivative with respect to the time of the velocity vector.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org

What is it ?

 The gravity sensor provides a three dimensional vector indicating the direction and magnitude of gravity. Typically, this sensor is used to determine the device's relative orientation in space. When a device is at rest, the output of the gravity sensor should be identical to that of the accelerometer.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org

What is it ?

 A temperature sensor is the instrumentation equipment which is used to measure temperature or heat on the operating machine part. Temperature sensing is performed by equipment called Thermocouple. A thermocouple is a temperature-measuring device consisting of two dissimilar conductors that contact each other at one or more points. It produces a voltage when the temperature of one of the points differs from the reference temperature at other parts of the circuit.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org

What is it ?

 A humidity sensor (or hygrometer) senses, measures and reports both moisture and air temperature. The ratio of moisture in the air to the highest amount of moisture at a particular air temperature is called relative humidity.

 Explanation offered by the most famous online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.org
The device does not have these sensors :
Remove all the screenshots made from the app\'s folder.
Do you really want to remove all 0 screenshots taken ?
Set up the application light theme.
Set up the application dark theme.
Set up the dark theme when the battery percentage is under 30 %.
Doesn\'t set the dark theme based on battery percentage.
Set up the dark theme when it\'s later than 20:00 (08:00 pm).
Doesn\'t set the dark theme based on local time.
Doesn\'t keep the screen always on.
